segments.text: I'm primarily focused on that boy and his precarious position.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's balanced on a small, two-step stool, stretched out towards the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But those legs! They're splayed out, and the stool is clearly tilted backward.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It looks like it could tip over at any second, just a tiny shift in weight.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: My heart is pounding just watching him; he's so close to falling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: If he falls, he could really hurt himself, perhaps hit his head on the counter.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And what about the plate he's holding? That will certainly shatter.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is standing nearby, completely unaware of the imminent danger to her brother.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's just focused on getting a cookie, her hand outstretched expectantly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is oblivious to this danger too, lost in her dishwashing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could warn them about the unstable stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's such a tense moment in an otherwise mundane kitchen scene.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole situation just feels like an accident waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
